alert.note: Alert for Southern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A narrow band of torrential rainfall in east central Worcester and central Middlesex Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from Clinton to Northborough to near Mendon. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Framingham, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Natick, Acton, Hudson, Westborough, Grafton, Sudbury, Ashland, Hopkinton, Northborough, Clinton, Wayland, Maynard, Southborough, Littleton, Lancaster, Sterling and West Boylston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
